Section.Paragraph: The Duluth Word Alignment System participated in the 2003 HLT-NAACL Workshop on Parallel Text shared task on word alignment for both English-French and Romanian-English.
It is a Perl implementation of IBM Model 2.

We used approximately 50,000 aligned sentences as training data for each language pair, and found the results for Romanian-English to be somewhat better. We also varied the Model 2 distortion parameters among the values 2, 4, and 6, but did not observe any significant differences in performance as a result.
